fruitninja.model

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • fruitninja.model.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Apple, Bomb, Orange, Strawberry

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameObject class is a model class which contains the position, size, worth and speed of a Game Object. The class itself is abstract and therefore can not be instantiated. It merely provides a blueprint for all Game Objects.
    Since:
    2015-11-17
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the GameObject.
        Returns:
        The size of the GameObject.

      • getPoints

        public int getPoints()
        Returns the amount of points the GameObject is worth.
        Returns:
        The amount of points te GameObject is worth.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int x,
                        int y)
        Sets the position of the GameObject.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position where to set the GameObject to.
        y - The y position where to set the GameObject to.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(int x,
                        int y)
        Sets the velocity of the GameObject. This determines the direction and speed at which the GameObject will move. If a velocity is set to a negative value the object will move in the opposite (negative) direction.
        Parameters:
        x - The velocity at which the GameObject will move on the x-axis.
        y - The velocity at which the GameObject will move on the y-axis.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the x position of the GameObject.
        Returns:
        The x position of the GameObject as integer.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns the y position of the GameObject.
        Returns:
        The y position of the GameObject as integer.

      • update

        public void update(double time)
        This method is used to update the position of the GameObject. The position is calculated with the velocity and the time since the last update.
        Parameters:
        time - Time passed since last update in milliseconds.

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Returns the type of the GameObject. This is used for easy and fast type determination.
        • 0 - Apple
        • 1 - Orange
        • 2 - Strawberry
        • 3 - Bomb
        Returns:
        The type of the GameObject as integer.

      • insideBounds

        public boolean insideBounds(int x,
                            int y)
        This method is used to determine if a position is inside the bounds of the GameObject.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position to check.
        y - The y position to check.
        Returns:
        Whether the position is inside the bounds of the GameObject.
